citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There are two bottles of expired products in the facility that the licensee has been using routinely. A bottle of pyrantel
pamoate (de-wormer) expired 07/21/23 and a bottle of Forti Cal (nutritional supplement) expired 07/2023. Products being
used past the expiration date have unknown efficacy and potency; thus, they may no longer be efficacious for the labeled
indications of use. Correct by ensuring that the facility is using the appropriate methods to prevent and control diseases.
Correct from January 23, 2024, onward.

During the inspection, enclosures failed to adequately contain two Yorkie dogs. There is a row of open-topped enclosures.
The inspector observed the two dogs jumping over the sides (walls) of the enclosures and traveling from one enclosure to
the next. If dogs are not properly contained in their assigned enclosures there is concern for undesired breeding, fighting,
disease transmission, and overcrowding. Correct by ensuring the housing facilities contain the animals securely and
restrict other animals from entering. Correct from January 23, 2024, onward.

All adult dogs at the facility are not up to date on all three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies
vaccines). Of the 51 adult dogs, only 23 are up to date on all 3 required vaccinations.
- Female #0500 has no record of vaccinations. The Rabies and distemper/parvovirus vaccines are due.
- Female #0263 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #0313 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #2148 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #2181 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #3415 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #6901 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7013 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7014 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7018 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7019 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7521 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #7522 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #9442 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #1589 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #9850 is due for the distemper/parvovirus vaccine. The Rabies is current.
- Female #0493 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #0275 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #2222 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #6102 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #7012 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #7016 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #3512 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #3506 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #5455 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
- Female #5456 is due for the Rabies vaccine. The distemper/parvovirus vaccine is current.
Distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies are viruses that can cause infected dogs stress, discomfort, pain, or even death. It is
important for breeding females to receive proper vaccinations because they will transfer immunity to their offspring. The
current Program of Vet Care prescribes the distemper/parvovirus vaccines yearly and the Rabies vaccine every 1-3 years
(depending on age and vaccine status of the dog) in adult dogs. Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases such
as distemper, parvovirus, and Rabies must be given in accordance with the Program of Vet Care. Correct by following the
vaccination plan for adult dogs in the Program of Vet Care and update vaccines.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There are two bottles of expired products in the facility that the licensee has been using routinely. A bottle of pyrantel 
pamoate (de-wormer)  expired 07/21/23 and a bottle of Forti Cal (nutritional supplement) expired 07/2023. Products being 
used past the expiration date have unknown efficacy and potency; thus, they may no longer be efficacious for the labeled 
indications of use. Correct by ensuring that the facility is using the appropriate methods to prevent and control diseases. 
Correct from January 23, 2024, onward. 
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
During the inspection, enclosures failed to adequately contain two Yorkie dogs. There is a row of open-topped  enclosures. 
The inspector observed the two dogs jumping over the sides (walls) of the enclosures and traveling from one enclosure to 
the next. If dogs are not properly contained in their assigned enclosures there is concern for undesired breeding, fighting, 
disease transmission, and overcrowding.  Correct by ensuring the housing facilities contain the animals securely and 
restrict other animals from entering. Correct from January 23, 2024, onward. 
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
All adult dogs at the facility are not up to date on all three of the required vaccinations (distemper, parvovirus,  and Rabies 
vaccines). Of the 51 adult dogs, only 23 are up to date on all 3 required vaccinations. 
- Female #0500 has no record of vaccinations. The Rabies and distemper/parvovirus  vaccines are due.

Distemper, parvovirus,  and Rabies are viruses that can cause infected dogs stress, discomfort, pain, or even death. It is

current Program of Vet Care prescribes the distemper/parvovirus  vaccines yearly and the Rabies vaccine every 1-3 years 
(depending on age and vaccine status of the dog) in adult dogs. Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases such 
as distemper, parvovirus,  and Rabies must be given in accordance with the Program of Vet Care. Correct by following the 
vaccination plan for adult dogs in the Program of Vet Care and update vaccines. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
